name: Naeem Cheekkappurath
review: I’ve been using the Echo Dot (5th Gen) for a while now, and I’m genuinely impressed with how much power this small device packs. The sound quality is excellent — clear vocals with surprisingly deep bass for its size. It easily fills my room with music and works great for podcasts or audiobooks too.Alexa is faster and more responsive than before. Whether I’m setting reminders, checking the weather, or controlling my smart lights and plugs, it responds instantly. The microphone sensitivity is also very good — it can hear me even when music is playing.The design is sleek and modern, blending perfectly with my desk setup. I also love the LED display on top that shows the time and volume level. It doubles nicely as a small bedside clock.Overall, the Echo Dot (5th Gen) feels like a solid upgrade over the older versions. Great sound, smart features, and reliable performance — totally worth the price!

name: satish
review: I’ve been using this device since May 2023, and honestly, from day one, I’ve felt disappointed with my purchase. There are a few ongoing issues that really need attention:1. Poor voice recognition: It doesn’t recognise words properly, especially Indian English. In reality, when we ask for Telugu or Tamil songs, it just doesn’t understand or play the correct ones.2. Frequent disconnection issues: Every 3–4 months, it disconnects on its own, and I have to reset it to make it work again. This time, it hasn’t connected for the last 10 days.3. Lack of helpful suggestions: Alexa should give regular suggestions through the mobile app or YouTube on how to make better use of it. Right now, we only use it for songs, reminders, time, and weather.4. Maintenance issue: My Echo is kept in the kitchen, and it has tiny holes that easily collect dust. I have no idea how to clean them safely.Overall, I feel quite disappointed that I bought this. I should have gone for a Google product instead — at least it understands Indian English and regional language names much better.

review: The ultrasonic motion detector is unusable, it works like 10% of the time only. Google it up guys, everyone is complaining about it.Sound recognition is better in English than in Hindi. You can only talk to Alexa in simple sentences. Can't process multiple sentences (Alexa, turn off fan and turn on the bulb) or complex queries. Sound quality is impressive but to play music, you must have Amazon Prime membership or Spotify Premium. It also can't tell you when a place is open or close by looking at Google Maps, only Google Nest speakers have that functionality. Not just its use cases are very less, half of the time, it misinterprets what you are saying, so you have to reframe your command it different ways. For the whole day, if you have to keep on saying "Alexa, ... Alexa ...", it feels awkward; Your family will look at you as if you are an idiot.In the Alexa app, I can't save my house address, it shows error?? Also, the app is slow, for each menu you click, it has to fetch data from the cloud.When I tell it, "Turn on the geyser for 10 minutes", it instead, turns on my geyser after 10 minutes. When I tell it "For 10 minutes, turn on my geyser.". That's when it understands my query and does what I want. So, you have to remember what combination works and what doesn't. If you say "pankha chala do" instead of "fan chala do", then it will say that "No device named Pankha is found". So, you have to remember the names of the devices. Like, I have multiple tubelights on smart home n/w. But I've to save their name differently, one is named "tubelight", other is named "bulb".It rained yesterday, but when I asked Alexa if it rained yesterday, it said "No ...". So you can't believe it to know the weather as well.When I ask Alexa about which one of my Amazon Delivery is due today, it instead reads all of my delivery.In plain words, it mostly sucks.Only useful query are these simple sentences: "Alexa, turn off entryway light", "Alexa, turn on the socket", etc.Google Home Mini is cheaper at Rs.4.5kIts Assistant AI is better.
